org.jdiscript.requests

Class EventRequestProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdiscript.requests.EventRequestProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler

    public class EventRequestProxy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
    An EventRequestProxy wraps a JDI EventRequest in order to make it chainable, by returning the EventRequestProxy itself for void EventRequest configuration methods (non-void EventRequest methods are unaffected).

    Additionally, EventRequestProxy provides the common implementation of the addHandler method specified by JDIScriptEventRequest subinterfaces.

    • Method Detail

      • proxy

        public static <T> T proxy(com.sun.jdi.request.EventRequest origRequest,
                          java.lang.Class<T> iface)
        Convenience method for creating a new dynamic proxy instance using an EventRequestProxy.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        origRequest - The EventRequest to proxy.
        iface - The interface to implement. This should be one of the JDIScriptEventRequest subinterfaces.
        Returns:
        A dynamic proxy instance implementing the given interface using an EventRequestProxy.

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object proxy,
                               java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                               java.lang.Object[] args)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        Dynamic proxy invocation method for chaining.

        For all methods defined for the underlying EventRequest, the underlying method is invoked. If that method is void, return the proxy object for chaining. Otherwise, return the result of the underlying method.

        For invocations of addHandler, add the given DebugEventHandler according to jdiscript's handler conventions (DebugEventDispatcher.addHandler(com.sun.jdi.request.EventRequest, org.jdiscript.handlers.DebugEventHandler)).

        Specified by:
        invoke in interface java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
